response.overview: The true story of pianist Władysław Szpilman's experiences in Warsaw during the Nazi occupation. When the Jews of the city find themselves forced into a ghetto, Szpilman finds work playing in a café; and when his family is deported in 1942, he stays behind, works for a while as a laborer, and eventually goes into hiding in the ruins of the war-torn city.
response.tagline: Music was his passion. Survival was his masterpiece.
response.title: The Pianist

cast.name: Ryszard Kluge
cast.character: Jew Working on the Bulding Site (uncredited)
